Description: 2 fragments of spacer-beads, 2 fragments of ear-rings, one pendant and 181 beads in different shapes and materials: A: Two fragments of spacer-beads, made of white faience, one time two segments preserved, the other time one segment, about the same height. B: Two fragments of penannular ear-rings, one made of white faience, rectangular section, the other made of shell, well smoothed on the outside. C: One pendant-like bead made of light green faience, like the lower part of a poppy seed pendant but lengthwise perforated. D: One spherical bead made of turquoise glass, corroded with a greyish layer. E: One larger roughly disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell, irregular outer surface. F: Two cylindrical beads, made of white faience, one very long, the other quite short. G: 19 fragments of cylindrical segmented beads, made of white faience, of slightly different diameters. H: 17 elongated spherical beads, made of white faience, quite poor quality, mostly with edges at each end. I: One broken original spherical bead made of glass (?) with gold foil, only small fragments preserved. J: 9 Ring-shaped beads, some rounder, some more disc-shaped, made of faience. 2 yellow, 2 blue, one red, two white and one black. K: Four larger ring-shaped beads made of faience, one white, three red. L: 5 middle sized disc-shaped beads made of faience, three white, one blue, one red. M: 112 small disc-shaped beads made of faience, 20 red, 16 black, two white, two blue and rest in beige.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
